description: The Meetup API provides simple RESTful HTTP and streaming interfaces for extending your community using the Meetup platform from your own apps.

blocks.name: getCategories
blocks.description: Returns a list of Meetup group categories

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: fields
args.info: Parameter for requesting optional response properties

blocks.name: getDashboard
blocks.description: A dashboard of aggregated Meetup information for the authorized member

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: fields
args.info: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output

blocks.name: getTopicCategories
blocks.description: Returns a list of Meetup topic categories

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: fields
args.info: Parameter for requesting optional response properties

args.name: radius
args.info: Use a given lat/lon/radius (miles) to search best_topics for instead of using the member's lat/lon.  When present, all three are required.

args.name: lon
args.info: Use a given lat/lon/radius (miles) to search best_topics for instead of using the member's lat/lon.  When present, all three are required.

args.name: lat
args.info: Use a given lat/lon/radius (miles) to search best_topics for instead of using the member's lat/lon.  When present, all three are required.

blocks.name: getTopics
blocks.description: API method for accessing meetup topics

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: memberId
args.info: Return topics a target member is subscribed to

args.name: name
args.info: Return topics that match the specified name (e.g. 'Digital Photography', 'Classical Music')

args.name: topic
args.info: Return topics for this topic urlkey

args.name: search
args.info: Return topics related to a list of search terms [separate search keywords with +'s]

blocks.name: getStreamOpenEvents
blocks.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: andText
args.info: Changes the interpretation of the "text" field from OR'd terms to AND'd terms

args.name: lat
args.info: Required: A valid latitude, limits the returned group events to those within radius miles

args.name: zip
args.info: Required: A valid US zip code, limits the returned groups to those within radius miles

args.name: country
args.info: Required: A valid country code

args.name: topic
args.info: Required: Return events in the specified topic or topics specified by commas. This is the topic "urlkey" returned by the Topics method. If all supplied topics are unknown, a 400 error response is returned with the code "badtopic".

args.name: city
args.info: Required: A valid city

args.name: limitedEvents
args.info: Include limited event information for private groups that wish to expose only a small amount of information about their events. This includes just: id, name, utc_offset, time, duration, yes_rsvp_count, waitlist_count, group, visibility, timezone. Value must be true or false.

args.name: textFormat
args.info: Format of the description text, "html" or "plain". Defaults to "html"

args.name: state
args.info: Required: If searching in a country with states, a valid 2 character state code

args.name: text
args.info: Required: Events that contain the given term or terms somewhere in their content. The terms are OR'd by default. Separate terms with " AND " for events that have combined terms. To have terms automatically AND'd, set the "and_text" to true

args.name: category
args.info: Required: Return events in the specified category or categories specified by commas. This is the category id returned by the Categories method.

args.name: lon
args.info: Required: A valid longitude, limits the returned group events to those within radius miles

args.name: time
args.info: Return events scheduled within the given time range, defined by two times separated with a single comma. Each end of the range may be specified with relative dates, such as "1m" for one month from now, or by absolute time in milliseconds since the epoch. If an endpoint is omitted, the range is unbounded on that end. The default value is unbounded on both ends (though restricted to the search window described above). Note: to retrieve past events you must also update status value

args.name: radius
args.info: Radius, in miles for geographic requests, default 25.0 -- maximum 100. May also be specified as "smart", a dynamic radius based on the number of active groups in the area

args.name: fields
args.info: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output

args.name: status
args.info: Status may be "upcoming", "past" or both separated by a comma. The default is "upcoming" only

blocks.name: getConcierge
blocks.description: Recommends upcoming meetups for the authorized member in a given location and in thier groups

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: zip
args.info: A valid US zip code, limits the returned groups to those within radius miles

args.name: country
args.info: A valid country code

args.name: city
args.info: A valid city

args.name: lon
args.info: A valid longitude, limits the returned group events to those within radius miles

args.name: textFormat
args.info: Format of the description text, "html", "plain", or "simplehtml". Defaults to "html"

args.name: categoryId
args.info: Comma delimited list of category ids to limit recommendations to

args.name: pageToken
args.info: An opaque string used to page through results. This can be found appended to the 'next' link in the meta section of the response.

args.name: state
args.info: If searching in a country with states, a valid 2 character state code

args.name: time
args.info: Return events scheduled within the given time range, defined by two times separated with a single comma. Each end of the range may be specified with relative dates, such as "1m" for one month from now, or by absolute time in milliseconds since the epoch. If an endpoint is omitted, the range is unbounded on that end. The default value is unbounded on both ends (though restricted to the search window described above). Note: to retrieve past events you must also update status value

args.name: topicId
args.info: Comma delimited list of topics to help inform recommendation

args.name: radius
args.info: Radius, in miles for geographic requests, defaults to the member's preferred radius or 0.5 -- maximum 100. May also be specified as "smart", a dynamic radius based on the number of active groups in the area

args.name: fields
args.info: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output

args.name: withFriends
args.info: Boolean parameter. When set to true, events hosted by groups you have friends in will be recommended

args.name: selfGroups
args.info: set to "include" or "exclude" groups the authorized member belongs to. The default is "include". This includes groups in locations that may differ than the provided location

args.name: lat
args.info: A valid latitude, limits the returned group events to those within radius miles

blocks.name: getGroups
blocks.description: Fetch information about Meetup Groups.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: groupnum
args.info: Return the group with this topic and number

args.name: topic
args.info: Required: Return the group with this topic and number

args.name: zip
args.info: Required: A valid US zip code, limits the returned groups to those within radius miles.

args.name: lon
args.info: A valid latitude and longitude, limits the returned groups to those within radius miles

args.name: lat
args.info: Required: A valid latitude and longitude, limits the returned groups to those within radius miles

args.name: groupUrlname
args.info: Required: one or more separated by commas, includes no slashes

args.name: topic
args.info: Required: Only return groups in the specified topic [one topic allowed]

args.name: groupId
args.info: Required: one or more separated by commas

args.name: organizerId
args.info: Required: one or more organizer IDs, separated by commas

args.name: domain
args.info: Required: one or more custom group domains, separated by commas

args.name: memberId
args.info: Required: one or more separated by commas, for groups this member belongs to

args.name: radius
args.info: Radius, in miles for geographic requests, default 25 -- maximum 100

args.name: fields
args.info: optional result fields, separated by commas.

args.name: categoryId
args.info: Required: Only return groups in the specified category. [one category allowed]

args.name: state
args.info: A valid country code, city and for the US, State. limits the returned groups to those within radius miles

args.name: city
args.info: A valid country code, city and for the US, State. limits the returned groups to those within radius miles

args.name: country
args.info: Required: A valid country code, city and for the US, State. limits the returned groups to those within radius miles

blocks.name: getEvents
blocks.description: Access Meetup events using a group, member, or event id. Events in private groups are available only to authenticated members of those groups. To search events by topic or location, see [Open Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/open_events).

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: rsvp
args.info: Required: Filters events by the currently authenticated member's RSVP status. May be a comma delimited list of "yes", "no", "waitlist", "maybe" or "none"

args.name: groupUrlname
args.info: Required: Path to group from meetup.com, no slashes

args.name: eventId
args.info: Required: Multiple ids may be separated with commas

args.name: groupId
args.info: Required: Multiple ids may be separated with commas

args.name: limitedEvents
args.info: Include limited event information for private groups that wish to expose only a small amount of information about their events. This includes just: id, name, utc_offset, time, duration, yes_rsvp_count, waitlist_count, group, visibility, timezone. Value must be true or false.

args.name: textFormat
args.info: Format of the description text, "html" or "plain". Defaults to "html"

args.name: groupDomain
args.info: Required: Group custom domain

args.name: venueId
args.info: Required: Multiple ids may be separated with commas

args.name: memberId
args.info: Required: Single member id, to find events in this member's groups

args.name: time
args.info: Return events scheduled within the given time range, defined by two times separated with a single comma. Each end of the range may be specified with relative dates, such as "1m" for one month from now, or by absolute time in milliseconds since the epoch. If an endpoint is omitted, the range is unbounded on that end. The default value is unbounded on both ends (though restricted to the search window described above). Note: to retrieve past events you must also update status value

args.name: fields
args.info: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output

args.name: status
args.info: Status may be "upcoming", "past", "proposed", "suggested", "cancelled", "draft" or multiple separated by a comma. The default is "upcoming", which includes Meetups that are happening now according to their **duration**. Meetups that are "proposed" or "suggested" do not have a date assigned; the former are listed on the site as official while the latter appear as in the making. Drafts are only visible to organizers of groups hosting the events.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: rsvpLimit
args.info: Total number of RSVPs available for the event

args.name: rsvpOpen
args.info: Users with permission may set the RSVP open time for the event. The time may be specified in milliseconds since the epoch, or relative to the current time in the d/w/m format.

args.name: venueVisibility
args.info: Controls the visibility of the event venue for non members of the hosting group. May be one of "public" or "members"

args.name: hosts
args.info: Up to 5 comma-separated valid member ids to be hosts for the event. If hosts is not provided, the authorized member is the default host

args.name: addNewQuestions
args.info: Those with permission may include up to 6 survey questions for the event with each being up to 250 characters. See the parameter notes section for more information

args.name: groupUrlname
args.info: Required: URL name of the Group hosting the event

args.name: why
args.info: We should do this because... May not be longer than 250 characters.

args.name: description
args.info: Longer description of the event, in HTML. May not be longer than 50000 characters.

args.name: howToFindUs
args.info: The information provided by the event host for "How will members find you there?". Visible when location is visible to the authenticated member

args.name: groupId
args.info: Required: Group hosting the event

args.name: rsvpClose
args.info: Users with permission may set the RSVP close time for the event. The time may be specified in milliseconds since the epoch, or relative to the current time in the d/w/m format.

args.name: duration
args.info: Event duration in milliseconds. When not specified, a default of 3 hours may be assumed by applications. To clear event duration, set this to 0

args.name: name
args.info: Required: Name of the event. May not be longer than 80 characters.

args.name: guestLimit
args.info: Number of guests members may include in their RSVP, 0 or more

args.name: simpleHtmlDescription
args.info: Description of the event, in simple HTML format. This value is translated to HTML to update the description. May not be longer than 50000 characters.

args.name: time
args.info: Event start time in milliseconds since the epoch, or relative to the current time in the d/w/m format.

args.name: venueId
args.info: Numeric identifier of a venue

args.name: publishStatus
args.info: If you are an organizer of the group, you may set this to "draft" to save the event as a draft. Doing so will require a status=draft filter on /2/event queries.

blocks.name: editEvent
blocks.description: Update an existing Meetup

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: lon
args.info: Updates to the venue's latitude and longitude. When present, both must be provided

args.name: lat
args.info: Updates to the venue's latitude and longitude. When present, both must be provided

args.name: rsvpLimit
args.info: Total number of RSVPs available for the event. To remove this limit, set this to 0

args.name: rsvpOpen
args.info: Users with permission may set the RSVP open time for the event. The time may be specified in milliseconds since the epoch, or relative to the current time in the d/w/m format.

args.name: venueVisibility
args.info: Controls the visibility of venue. May be one of "public" or "members"

args.name: hosts
args.info: Up to 5 valid member ids to be hosts for the event.

args.name: addNewQuestions
args.info: Those with permission may include up to 6 survey questions with each being up to 250 characters, including edited questions, for the event. See the parameter notes section for more information

args.name: why
args.info: We should do this because... May not be longer than 250 characters.

args.name: description
args.info: Longer description of the event, in HTML. May not be longer than 50000 characters.

args.name: howToFindUs
args.info: The information provided by the event host for "How will members find you there?". Visible when location is visible to the authenticated member

args.name: rsvpClose
args.info: Users with permission may set the RSVP close time for the event. The time may be specified in milliseconds since the epoch, or relative to the current time in the d/w/m format. To unset rsvp_close, set this to 0

args.name: announce
args.info: Organizers and hosts may set this to true to announce a Meetup.

args.name: duration
args.info: Event duration in milliseconds. When not specified, a default of 3 hours may be assumed by applications. To clear event duration, set this to 0

args.name: groupId
args.info: Group to hold the event

args.name: name
args.info: Event name. May not be longer than 80 characters.

args.name: guestLimit
args.info: number of guests members may include in their RSVP, 0 or more

args.name: simpleHtmlDescription
args.info: Description of the event, in simple HTML format. This value is translated to HTML to update the description. May not be longer than 50000 characters.

args.name: time
args.info: event start time in milliseconds since the epoch, or relative to the current time in the d/w/m format.

args.name: editQuestions
args.info: Those with permission may include up to 6 survey questions with each being up to 250 characters, including new questions. To delete a question submit this parameter with an empty value

args.name: venueId
args.info: Numeric identifier of a venue. To unset the event's venue, set this to 0

args.name: publishStatus
args.info: If you are an organizer of the group, you may set this to "draft" or "published". Setting state to "draft" will require a status=draft filter on /2/event queries.

blocks.name: deleteEvent
blocks.description: Deletes a specified meetup

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

blocks.name: getCities
blocks.description: Returns Meetup cities. This method supports search by latitude/longitude/radius, by country/state, by query term/zip, or a combination of all of these. Location-only searches by lat and lon return all cities within a radius of the provided coordinates. Searches with a query return up to 10 cities matching the term, and can be sorted by size or distance to a given coordinate. 'smart' ordering can be used to return the match(es) with the highest member_count, unless a smaller size match exists nearby the given coordinates. Query searches are supported for country but not country and state

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: country
args.info: A valid country code

args.name: query
args.info: Search term and/or zip to look for (if this is specified, max result size limited to 10)

args.name: lon
args.info: Longitude to search

args.name: state
args.info: A valid state code for the given country, if the country has states

args.name: radius
args.info: When searching by lat/lon only, specify a radius to search (default 50 miles)

args.name: lat
args.info: Latitude to search

blocks.name: getMembers
blocks.description: API method for accessing members of Meetup Groups

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: groupnum
args.info: Return members for the group with given topic and number

args.name: topic
args.info: Required: Return members for the group with given topic and number

args.name: groupUrlname
args.info: Required: Return members for the group with the given custom URL path

args.name: memberId
args.info: Required: Return the member with this ID

args.name: fields
args.info: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output.

args.name: groupId
args.info: Required: Return members in groups with these ID numbers, separated by commas

args.name: service
args.info: Required: Match users by the external services they've linked to their member account, specified as "servicename:identifier". For example, "service=twitter:@MeetupAPI" finds any member account that lists @MeetupAPI as its Twitter name (none, currently). You can query against several at a time by separating them with commas. Facebook identifiers should be provided as numeric values

blocks.name: getSingleMember
blocks.description: Retrieve a single member

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: fields
args.info: comma-separate list of optional fields

blocks.name: editSignleMember
blocks.description: Edit the authorized member's attributes

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: birthday
args.info: Day you were born. Format should be in the form of yyyy or mmddyyyy. A value of -1 indicates that birthday data should be cleared.

args.name: zip
args.info: Valid zip code for city

args.name: country
args.info: Valid country code for your location

args.name: hometown
args.info: Hometown of member. Can not be longer than 64 characters

args.name: removeTopics
args.info: Comma-delimited list of topic ids to remove from your alert list

args.name: gender
args.info: Your gender (used for better recommendations). Value may be one of other, none, female, male

args.name: photoId
args.info: A valid photo_id from the member's photos to set as the main profile photo. A value of 0 will unset the current photo

args.name: city
args.info: City name for your location

args.name: topicsPrivacy
args.info: Controls the visibility of the member's topics. May be one of visible, hidden

args.name: facebookPrivacy
args.info: Controls the visibility of the member's facebook connection. May be one of visible, hidden. If the member has not connected their Facebook account, attempts to set this preference will do nothing.

args.name: bio
args.info: Free form text passage about you. must be less than 250 characters

args.name: lon
args.info: longitude of city

args.name: groupsPrivacy
args.info: Controls the visibility of the member's groups. May be one of visible, hidden

args.name: addTopics
args.info: Comma-delimited list of topics ids to add to your alert list

args.name: syncPhoto
args.info: When set to true, this parameter will sync all of the group profile photos for the member with the provided photo_id

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the current member

args.name: bioPrivacy
args.info: Controls the visibility of the member's bio. May be one of visible, hidden

args.name: photosPrivacy
args.info: Controls the visibility of the member's photos. May be one of visible, hidden

args.name: lang
args.info: Language preference used on the site. Valid values are en-us, en-au, de-de, es, es-es, fr-fr, it-it, pt-br, ja-jp, ko-kr, nl-nl, en_us, en_au, de_de, es, es_es, fr_fr, it_it, pt_br, ja_jp, ko_kr, nl_nl, en, en, de, es, es, fr, it, pt, ja, ko, nl

args.name: radius
args.info: radius, in miles to search for city given a lat and lon. default 25.0, max 100.0

args.name: lat
args.info: latitude of city

args.name: messagingPref
args.info: This specifies the member's preference for being contacted from members on the site. Possible values are "orgs_only" meaning only group organizers can contact you, "groups_only" meaning only members of your group can contact you, or "all_members" meaning all members may contact you.

args.name: cityId
args.info: Valid city id from /2/cities method

blocks.name: getProfiles
blocks.description: This method returns member *profiles* associated with a particular group. Meetup members have separate profiles for each group they join.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: groupnum
args.info: Group identification by topic, deprecated

args.name: topic
args.info: Required: Group identification by topic, deprecated

args.name: role
args.info: if "leads", only profiles for members of the leadership team are included

args.name: groupUrlname
args.info: Required: Return profiles for the group with the given custom URL path

args.name: memberId
args.info: Required: Return the profiles for members with these IDs, separated by commas

args.name: fields
args.info: comma delimited list of optional response properties. A value of "membership_dues" will populate membership dues for the authorized user or members of the groups the authorized user organizes

args.name: groupId
args.info: Required: Return profiles in the group with this ID

args.name: status
args.info: Status filter for members. Only organizers may see pending. Request must also contain a `group_id` or `group_urlname`. Status may be one of active, pending

args.name: groupUrlname

args.name: intro

args.name: newPhoto
args.info: file upload for a new member photo

args.name: groupId
args.info: Required: Id of group to join

args.name: provideAnswer
args.info: Answers to questions from groups API join_info question fields

args.name: siteName

args.name: addRole

args.name: photoId
args.info: photo_id of the photo to use for this profile. set to 0 to unset the current photo

args.name: siteUrl
args.info: Link to member's site. Max length is 80

args.name: intro
args.info: Provides a Member an opportunity to tell the group about themselves

args.name: newPhoto
args.info: file upload for a new member photo

args.name: title

args.name: removeRole

args.name: provideAnswer

blocks.description: This method posts messages that appear under "Talk about this Meetup".

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: comment
args.info: Required: The comment text

args.name: inReplyTo
args.info: Required: If this comment is a reply, the ID of the comment being replied to

args.name: notifications
args.info: Notification control for authorized member on this comment thread. "on" will result in notifications being sent. "off" will opt the member out of notifications for this comment thread. Defaults to "on" unless the member previous opted out of notifications on the thread.

args.name: eventId
args.info: Required: The event related to this comment.

args.name: commentId
args.info: Required: Return likes for a given comment_id

blocks.name: getPhotoComments
blocks.description: This method returns comments on meetup photos. To post messages, see the corresponding write method

args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: memberId
args.info: Return comments for the given member_ids, separated by commas. The member ids must match up with one of the provided photo ids

args.name: photoId
args.info: Required: Return comments on these photos, separated by commas

args.name: fields
args.info: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output.

blocks.name: postPhotoComment
blocks.description: This method posts comments that appear below photos

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: photoId
args.info: Required: The photo related to this comment.

args.name: comment
args.info: Required: The comment text

blocks.name: getEventRatings
blocks.description: API method for accessing Meetup comments

args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: memberId
args.info: The ID of a member to filter ratings on

args.name: eventId
args.info: Required: The ID of the event to fetch ratings data for

blocks.name: postEventRating
blocks.description: This method allows members to posts rating for an event after it's occurred. Only permitted for members who rsvp'd "yes" or "maybe" to the event

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: attendeeCount
args.info: DEPRECATED: The number of attendees for the event (organizers/assistant organizers/co-organizers/event organizers/event hosts only)

args.name: rating
args.info: Required: The member's rating (either 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5)

args.name: eventId
args.info: Required: The ID of the event to fetch ratings data for

blocks.name: getPhotoAlbums
blocks.description: This method returns photo albums associated with Meetup groups. To create albums, see the corresponding write method.

args.name: photoAlbumId
args.info: Required: Return albums with these IDs, separated by commas

args.name: groupId
args.info: Required: Return albums in groups with these ID, separated by commas

args.name: eventId

args.name: groupId

args.name: title
args.info: Required:  Title of the new album

blocks.name: getOpenVenues
blocks.description: Searches for public venues within a given geo space. To search for specific venues that your group has used, use the [Venues](/meetup_api/docs/2/venues) method

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: lat
args.info: Required: A valid latitude, limits the returned venues to those within radius miles

args.name: state
args.info: Required: For the US, a valid 2 character state code

args.name: text
args.info: Required: Venues that contain the given term or terms somewhere in their content. Separate terms with " AND " for venues that have combined terms. Append a trailing * to treat this as a prefix search

args.name: zip
args.info: Required: A valid US zip code, limits the returned venues to those within radius miles

args.name: country
args.info: Required: A valid country code.

args.name: lon
args.info: Required: A valid longitude, limits the returned venues to those within radius miles

args.name: groupUrlname
args.info: Required: Returns venues with location relative to the group associated with this urlname

args.name: city
args.info: Required: A valid city

args.name: radius
args.info: Radius, in miles for geographic requests, default 25.0 -- maximum 100.0

args.name: fields
args.info: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output

blocks.name: getVenues
blocks.description: Search for Meetup venues by one of your groups, events, or venue identifiers. For a full text search on public venues use [OpenVenues](/meetup_api/docs/2/open_venues).

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: venueId
args.info: Required: multiple ids may be separated with commas

args.name: fields
args.info: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output

args.name: groupId
args.info: Required: multiple ids may be separated with commas

args.name: groupUrlname
args.info: Required: path to group from meetup.com, no slashes

args.name: eventId
args.info: Required: multiple ids may be separated with commas

blocks.name: getRSVPs
blocks.description: Query for Event RSVPs by event

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: fields
args.info: Parameter for requesting optional response properties, set to other_services for a list of third party services

args.name: rsvp
args.info: Filters response on RSVP status. "yes" if member RSVP'd yes otherwise "no"

args.name: eventId
args.info: Required: Multiple alphanumeric ids may be separated with commas

blocks.name: postRSVP
blocks.description: Creates or updates an existing RSVP

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: rsvp
args.info: Required: The RSVP setting - value must be either "yes", "no" or "waitlist"

args.name: memberId
args.info: Organizers and event hosts may RSVP on behalf of a member by specifying an ID here. As when editing RSVPs on the site, organizers may enter a "yes" for a member even if the event requires payment.

args.name: comments
args.info: A comment to post along with the RSVP

args.name: eventId
args.info: Required: The event that you are RSVP'ing to

args.name: guests
args.info: Number of guests also coming to the event.

args.name: optToPay
args.info: For events with fees, the authorized member may opt to pay as part of the RSVP request. This may be set to true or false

args.name: provideAnswer
args.info: Answers to event survey questions. Answers may not be longer than 250 characters. Organizers and hosts my not edit or create answers on behalf of members

args.name: agreeToRefund
args.info: For events with fees, the authorized member must agree to the event's refund policy. This must be set to either true or false

blocks.name: getSingleRSVP
blocks.description: Retrieve a single RSVP

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: fields
args.info: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output

blocks.name: postGroupPhoto
blocks.description: Uploads a new Meetup Group photo. To change other Group settings use the [Group Edit](/meetup_api/docs/:urlname/#edit) endpoint

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: await
args.info: If true, this ensures a response will not be returned until the upload is accessible

args.name: main
args.info: Set to 'true' to have this photo become the group's main photo. Set it to 'false' otherwise. Defaults to true

args.name: groupId
args.info: Required: Group ID for the target group. This may be used as an alternative to group_urlname

args.name: photo
args.info: Required: The photo, encoded as multipart/form-data. The maximum file size allowed is 10MB

args.name: groupUrlname
args.info: Required: Group urlname. This may be used as an alternative to group_id

blocks.name: postMemberPhoto
blocks.description: Uploads a photo to be associated with a Member

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: await
args.info: If true, this ensures a response will not be returned until the upload is accessible

args.name: main
args.info: Set to "true" to have this photo become the member's main profile photo. Otherwise, it will become the main photo only when none other is selected. If the authenticated member does not already have a main profile photo set it will remain so.

args.name: syncMatchingPhoto
args.info: When set to true and main is set to true, this will replace all group profile photos matching the current photo with the provided replacement

args.name: photo
args.info: Required: The photo, encoded as multipart/form-data. The maximum file size allowed is 10MB

args.name: syncPhoto
args.info: When set to true, this parameter will sync all of the group profile photos for the member with the provided photo_id

blocks.name: postPhoto
blocks.description: Uploads a photo for a given event

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: await
args.info: If true, this ensures a response will not be returned until the upload is accessible

args.name: caption
args.info: Caption for the photo

args.name: photoAlbumId
args.info: Required: Identifier of an existing photo album, which may be an event or group album

args.name: photo
args.info: Required: The photo, encoded as multipart/form-data. The maximum file size allowed is 10MB

args.name: eventId
args.info: Required: Identifier of an event. If there is no album for this event, one will be created.

blocks.name: getActivity
blocks.description: API method for retrieving the activity feed for a member's groups

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: memberId
args.info: Returns activity from this member's groups. Must be authenticated as this member

args.name: pageStart
args.info: Starting timestamp for item to return.

blocks.name: getOEMBed
blocks.description: oEmbed implementation

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: url
args.info: Required: url of resource to be embedded

args.name: maxwidth
args.info: maximum width to display

blocks.name: getRSVPs
blocks.description:
This [long-polling](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comet_%28programming%29#Script_tag_long_polling) 
stream can be easily consumed using JavaScript in any modern browser. RSVP
notifications are received when they happen, or as soon as your script finishes handling its
last notification.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: callback
args.info:
Required: Name of a function to be called with an array of RSVP notification objects. If this 
parameter is not supplied, the chunked stream is joined instead.

args.name: sinceMtime
args.info: Should be supplied for all but the first polling request, so that any missed notifications are can be sent in an immediate response

args.name: sinceCount
args.info: Request that some number of recent messages be sent immediately, if available. May not be specified in the same request as since_mtime.

args.name: eventId
args.info: Limit notifications to a specific event id. Use alphanumeric ids for repeating events.

blocks.name: getRSVPs
blocks.description:
Live HTTP stream of RSVPs within public Meetup groups. This method uses [chunked 
transfer encoding](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chunked_transfer_encoding) 
to maintain a persistent connection with the client. This connection will only be 
terminated for server maintenance or a connection error.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: sinceMtime
args.info: Return recent RSVP with an mtime greater than the supplied time, in milliseconds since the epoch

args.name: sinceCount
args.info: Request that some number of recent messages be sent immediately, if available. May not be specified in the same request as since_mtime.

blocks.name: getStreamOpenEvents
blocks.description:
Live HTTP stream of events within public Meetup groups. This method uses [chunked
transfer encoding](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chunked_transfer_encoding)
to maintain a persistent connection with the client. This connection will only be
terminated for server maintenance or a connection error.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: sinceMtime
args.info: Return events with an mtime greater than the supplied time, in milliseconds since the epoch

args.name: sinceCount
args.info: Request that some number of recent messages be sent immediately, if available. May not be specified in the same request as since_mtime.

blocks.name: getOpenVenues
blocks.description:
Live HTTP stream of the creation and modification of public Meetup venues using
[chunked encoding](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chunked_transfer_encoding)
to maintian a persistent connection with a client. The connection will only be
terminiated for server maintenance or a connection error. It is suitable for
low-level HTTP clients rather than web browsers.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: sinceMtime
args.info: Return recent open venues with an mtime greater then the supplied time, in milliseconds since the epoch

args.name: sinceCount
args.info: Request that some number of recent messages be sent immediately, if available. May not be specified in the same request as since_mtime.

args.name: trickle
args.info: When supplied with a request, the Meetup API will push your client the entire Meetup database of public venues in batches of 512

blocks.name: getEventComments
blocks.description:
This [long-polling](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comet_%28programming%29#Script_tag_long_polling)
stream can be easily consumed using JavaScript in any modern browser. Event Comment
notifications are received when they happen, or as soon as your script finishes handling its
last notification.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: callback
args.info:
Required: Name of a function to be called with an array of Event Comment notification objects. If this
parameter is not supplied, the chunked stream is joined instead.

args.name: sinceMtime
args.info: Should be supplied for all but the first polling request, so that any missed notifications are can be sent in an immediate response

args.name: sinceCount
args.info: Request that some number of recent messages be sent immediately, if available. May not be specified in the same request as since_mtime.

args.name: eventId
args.info: Limit notifications to a specific event id. Use alphanumeric ids for repeating events.

blocks.name: getEventComments
blocks.description:
Live HTTP stream of Event Comments  within public meetup groups. This method uses [chunked
transfer encoding](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chunked_transfer_encoding)
to maintain a persistent connection with the client. This connection will only be
terminated for server maintenance or a connection error.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: sinceMtime
args.info: Return recent Event Comments with an mtime greater than the supplied time, in milliseconds since the epoch

args.name: sinceCount
args.info: Request that some number of recent messages be sent immediately, if available. May not be specified in the same request as since_mtime.

args.name: eventId
args.info: Limit notifications to a specific event id. Use alphanumeric ids for repeating events.

blocks.name: getStatus
blocks.description: Returns the current API service status

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

blocks.name: membershipApproval
blocks.description: Approves one or more requests for group membership

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: member
args.info: Comma-delimited numeric pending member IDs. The maximum allowed is 200

args.name: welcomeMessage
args.info: Optional message to send to the members being approved. If not provided, the groups default welcome message will be sent. Max message size is 2000

args.name: sendCopy
args.info: Optional boolean value indicating whether or not the org should receive a copy of the message sent to the approved members

blocks.name: getEventAttendance
blocks.description: Lists attendance records for Meetup events. Limited for use by administrative members.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: filter
args.info: A named filter to apply to the attendance list. These are roughly equivalent to the set of filters you will see in the attendance tool on the site. These filters correspond with attendance records as well as each member's original RSVP status. The filter value be one of: legacy, maybe, waitlist, yes, absent, all, attended, noshow, excused, relevant, no. The default is 'attended'. The 'absent' filter represents all members not in attendance including members with a 'noshow' status. An 'excused' absence is an absent member marked as such by an administrative member

args.name: member
args.info: Raw text used to search for member by name. This may only be applied when the filter parameter is set to 'all'. The provided text must consist of at least 2 characters.

blocks.name: takeEventAttendance
blocks.description: Takes member attendance for an event. Limited for use by administrative members.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: guests
args.info: The number of guests accompanying member. Maximum of 99 is allowed. When providing multiple values in the `member` field, this value is ignored

args.name: headcount
args.info: Sets the overall headcount for the event. This may not necessarily correlate with the list of attendees in this group if the event is part of a joint Meetup event. When providing multiple values in the `member` field, this value is ignored

args.name: member
args.info: Required: A comma-delimited list of valid ids associated with members RSVP'd to the event

args.name: status
args.info: Required: An attendance status for the provided members. Must be one of: noshow, absent, attended

blocks.name: getBoards
blocks.description: Listings of Group discussion boards

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

blocks.name: membershipDecline
blocks.description: Declines one or more requests for group membership

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: member
args.info: Comma-delimited numeric pending member IDs. The maximum allowed is 200

args.name: anon
args.info: Optional Boolean value indicating whether the declining member's email address should be hidden in the resulting response. Default is true.

args.name: sendCopy
args.info: Optional Boolean value indicating whether or not to send a copy to the member issuing the decline. Default is false

args.name: explanation
args.info: Optional explanation to send to the members being declined. Max message size is 2000

args.name: ban
args.info: Optional Boolean value indicating whether or not to ban the member in the future. Default is false

blocks.name: getDiscussions
blocks.description: Listings of group discussions

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

blocks.name: getSingleDiscussion
blocks.description: Listing Group discussion posts

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

blocks.name: getSelfEvents
blocks.description:
Gets a listing of all scheduled Meetup Events the authenticated member has RSVP'd to
that have been announced to the group.
This listing is ordered from oldest to most recent by default

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: scroll
args.info:
A string representing a scroll target.

Supported values are as follows.

__recent_past__: Scroll to the last RSVP'd Meetup Event that has passed.
 If there is no recent RSVP, this defaults to __next_upcoming__

__next_upcoming__: Scroll to the next upcoming Meetup Event the authenticated member
RSVP'd to.

Alternatively the server may generate a scroll value used for pagination Link headers.
Clients should treat the contents of those as a transparent string. Its
contents are subject to change in the future

args.name: page
args.info: Number of results to return. Defaults to 200.

args.name: fields
args.info: A comma-delimited list of optional fields names which may be appended to the response

args.name: rsvp
args.info:
Comma-delimited list of RSVP responses.
Valid values are "waitlist" or "yes". The default is "yes"

args.name: desc
args.info: When true, sorts results in descending order. Defaults to false

args.name: status
args.info:
Comma-delimited list of event statuses.
Valid values are "past" or "upcoming"

blocks.name: getSingleEvent
blocks.description: Fetches a Meetup Event by group urlname and event_id

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: fields
args.info: A comma-delimited list of optional fields to append to the response

blocks.name: postEventPayments
blocks.description: Allows organizers of a group to note payments made by members for an event. This is the 'Mark Paid' feature seen in the RSVP listings on event details pages and affects the 'pay_status' response fields in [2/rsvps](/meetup_api/docs/2/rsvps/#response) for paid events

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: amount
args.info: Required: The monetary amount of money the member submitted

args.name: quantity
args.info: The number of payments made. Defaults to 1

args.name: member
args.info: Required: Member Id of member who made a payment

args.name: paidOn
args.info: The time the payment was made in milliseconds from the epoc. Defaults to now

blocks.name: findGroups
blocks.description: Text, location, category and friend-based group searches

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: zip
args.info: Zipcode of location to limit search to

args.name: country
args.info: A valid two character country code, defaults to US

args.name: upcomingEvents
args.info: If true, filters text and category based searches on groups that have upcoming events. Defaults to false

args.name: lon
args.info: Approximate longitude

args.name: filter
args.info: Determines which groups are returned. If 'all' (default), the text and category parameters are applied. If 'friends', groups your friends are in are returned. The value of this parameter may be one of all, friends

args.name: fallbackSuggestions
args.info: boolean indicator of whether or not to return a list of curated suggestions for groups if we can't find groups matching your criteria

args.name: location
args.info: Raw text location query

args.name: text
args.info: Raw full text search query

args.name: topicId
args.info: Comma-delimited list of numeric topic ids

args.name: radius
args.info: Radius in miles. May be 0.0-100.0, 'global' or 'smart', a dynamic radius based on the number of active groups in the area. Defaults to member's preferred radius

args.name: fields
args.info: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output.

args.name: category
args.info: Comma-delimited list of numeric category ids

args.name: selfGroups
args.info: set to 'include' or 'exclude' Meetups the authorized member belongs to; default is 'include'

args.name: lat
args.info: Approximate latitude

blocks.name: getSingleGroup
blocks.description: Fetches a Meetup group by urlname

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: fields
args.info: A comma-delimited list of optional fields to append to the response

blocks.name: editGroup
blocks.description: Allows organizers to edit their Meetup group information. To change group topics, see the [add](/meetup_api/docs/:urlname/topics/#add) and [remove](/meetup_api/docs/:urlname/topics/#remove) topics endpoints. To change group photo use the [Group photo upload](/meetup_api/docs/2/group_photo/#create) endpoint. OAuth authenticated requests require an additional [group_edit](/meetup_api/auth/#oauth2-scopes) permission.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: zip
args.info: The ZIP code of the city

args.name: country
args.info: The ISO_3166-1 country code for the country which contains the city

args.name: listMode
args.info: Defines policy for who can post to the group mailing list. May be one of 'open' meaning any member can post, 'off' meaning no one can post, 'moderated' meaning messages must be approved, or 'orgs_only' meaning only organizers may post to the list

args.name: dryrun
args.info: Boolean parameter that will cause this endpoint to apply all validation rules without actually saving changes in which case the response will only reflect the group's current attributes

args.name: gaCode
args.info: Google Analytics code for group

args.name: removeTopics
args.info: Comma-delimited list of topic ids to disassociate with group

args.name: visibility
args.info: Restricts group visibility for non-members. May be one of 'public', 'public_limited' or 'members'. Note, the 'members' option is only available to groups that already have 'members' visibility

args.name: addNewQuestions
args.info: A new profile question defined in the order of index provided in the request parameter name

args.name: keyPhoto
args.info: Group's primary photo. Must be ID of an existing album photo

args.name: photoReq
args.info: Indicates that a member must provide a photo before joining. Expects true or false values

args.name: description
args.info: Summary of what the Meetup group is about in simple HTML format

args.name: questionsReq
args.info: Indicates that provided questions are required before joining. Expects true or false values

args.name: welcomeMessage
args.info: Message sent to members after they join. Can be at most 2000 characters

args.name: joinMode
args.info: Controls how member's are let into the group. May be one of 'open' meaning any Meetup member my join, 'closed' meaning group is not currently accepting new members, or 'approval' meaning members must be approved by an organizer. Note, the 'closed' options is only available to groups that already have a 'closed' join_mode

args.name: listAddr
args.info: Mailing list prefix. By default this is the group's urlname.

args.name: addTopics
args.info: Comma-delimited list of topic ids to associate with group

args.name: serviceUri
args.info: A URI for a social network service. Service must be one of facebook, flickr, linkedin, other, tumblr, twitter

args.name: name
args.info: Display name of the group. Can be at most 60 characters

args.name: editQuestions
args.info: Edits a current profile question identified by an id in the parameter name. The index updated index should also be encoded in the parameter name. To delete a question, set this to an empty string. Groups that require profile questions must have at least one question

args.name: urlname
args.info: Name used for the groups web address on meetup.com. Must be between 6 and 60 characters

args.name: who
args.info: What members of the group will be called. Can be at most 32 characters

blocks.name: postTopics
blocks.description: Associates topics with a given Meetup group. Limited to organizers of the group. OAuth authenticated requests require an additional [group_edit](/meetup_api/auth/#oauth2-scopes) permission.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: topicId
args.info: Required: Comma-delimited list of topic ids to associate with group

blocks.name: deleteTopics
blocks.description: Disassociates topics with a given Meetup group. Limited to organizers of the group. OAuth authenticated requests require an additional [group_edit](/meetup_api/auth/#oauth2-scopes) permission.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: topicId
args.info: Required: Comma-delimited list of topic ids to disassociate with group

blocks.name: getLocations
blocks.description: Provides a query interface for finding known locations

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: lon
args.info:
Search for locations based on location longitude.
Must be provided with "lat"

args.name: page
args.info:
The desired number of locations to return in a single set of results.
Defaults to 200

args.name: offset
args.info: The current offset in the paginated set, represented as an incrementing value

args.name: lat
args.info:
Search for locations based on location latitude.
Must be provided with "lon"

args.name: query
args.info: Search for locations based on city name or zip code

blocks.name: getSelfCalendar
blocks.description: Get a listing of all upcoming Meetup events for the authenticated member

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: fields
args.info: A comma-delimited list of optional fields names which may be appended to the response

args.name: page
args.info: Number of results to return in a page. Defaults to 200

blocks.name: getSelfGroups
blocks.description:
Lists the authenticated member's groups in the order of leadership,
next upcoming event, then alphabetical order by name

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: fields
args.info: A comma-delimited list of optional fields to append to the response

args.name: page
args.info:
Number of groups to return in a single page of results.
By default, this is 200

blocks.name: getPROGroups
blocks.description: Name and statistics range search for the meetup groups belonging to Pro organization.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: country

blocks.name: getNotifications
blocks.description: Returns all recent Meetup notifications for the authorized member. To mark notifications read use [/notifications/read](/meetup_api/docs/notifications/read/) endpoint. To get the authenticated Member's current unread count, request it in an [HTTP header](/meetup_api/docs/#meta-headers).

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: fields
args.info: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output.

blocks.name: setNotificationsRead
blocks.description: Marks groups of [notifications](/meetup_api/docs/notifications/) as read.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: fields
args.info: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output.

args.name: sinceId
args.info: The id of the newest notification item, typically the first in the list returned by the notifications endpoint

blocks.name: findTopicCategories
blocks.description: Returns a list high level topic categories

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: lon
args.info: An optional approximate longitude to center a request for "best_topics"

args.name: fields
args.info: A comma-limited list of optional fields to append to the response

args.name: radius
args.info: An radius (in miles) to center a request for "best_topics"

args.name: lat
args.info: An optional approximate latitude to center a request for "best_topics"

blocks.name: getRecommendedGroupTopics
blocks.description: Recommends suggestions for group topics based on a text search or other topics

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: page
args.info: Target number of recommendations to return. Defaults to 36.

args.name: text
args.info: Free form text search

args.name: lang
args.info: Defines a language preference for ordering results. Valid values are en-USen-AUde-DEeses-ESfr-FRit-ITpt-BRja-JPko-KRnl-NLen-aude-dept-bren-uses-esnl-nlit-itfr-frko-krja-jpendefritptjakonl. You may also substitute this with the Accept-Language header

args.name: otherTopics
args.info: A comma-delimited list of topic ids to inform recommendations

args.name: excludeTopics
args.info: A comma-delimited list of topic ids to exclude from the recommendations

blocks.name: getRecommendedGroups
blocks.description: Returns groups Meetup finds relevant to you

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: zip
args.info: Zip code you are searching for recommendations in

args.name: country
args.info: A valid two character country code, defaults to US

args.name: instantJoinOnly
args.info: Recommend only groups without join requirements and that can be joined instantly

args.name: location
args.info: Raw text location query

args.name: lon
args.info: Approximate longitude

args.name: topicId
args.info: Comma delimited list of up to 100 topic ids to help inform recommendations

args.name: radius
args.info: Radius in miles. May be 0.0-100.0, 'global' or 'smart', a dynamic radius based on the number of active groups in the area. Defaults to member's preferred radius

args.name: fields
args.info: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output.

args.name: category
args.info: A valid category id which limits recommended groups to a particular category

args.name: lat
args.info: Approximate latitude

blocks.name: postRecommendedGroupsIgnore
blocks.description: Provides a form of feedback by requesting to remove a group from future recommendations

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

blocks.name: getRecommendedVenues
blocks.description: Returns venues Meetup finds relevant to you based on location and category. This method does not yet support sorting or pagination.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: zip
args.info: Zip code you are searching for recommendations in

args.name: country
args.info: A valid two character country code, defaults to US

args.name: usedBetween
args.info: Return venues that have been used within the given time range, defined by two times separated with a single comma. Each end of the range may be specified with relative dates, such as "1m" for one month from now, or by absolute time in milliseconds since the epoch. If an endpoint is omitted, the range is unbounded on that end. The default value is unbounded on both ends (though restricted to the search window described above).

args.name: minGroups
args.info: The minimum number of groups that have hosted events at this venue

args.name: groupId
args.info: Comma-delimited list of up to 200 group ids to help inform recommendations

args.name: location
args.info: Raw text location query

args.name: lon
args.info: Approximate longitude

args.name: radius
args.info: Radius in miles. Defaults to member's preferred radius

args.name: category
args.info: Comma-delimited list of up to 200 category ids to help inform recommendations

args.name: groupUrlname
args.info: Comma-delimited list of up to 200 group urlnames to help inform recommendations

args.name: lat
args.info: Approximate latitude

blocks.name: getSimilarGroups
blocks.description: Renders a list of similar groups

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

blocks.name: findTopics
blocks.description: Find topics by name

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: query
args.info: Required: The text to topic text search for

args.name: page
args.info: Number of results to return in a single set of results
